677366.name: Twiddle-Muff!
677366.notes_html:
Twiddle-muffs are being used in dementia wards across the country as the buttons, beads, ribbons, and textured yarn on the Twiddle -muffs offer distraction and stimulation to those with dementia.

These creations are SO easy to make and you can have so much fun in the process; they consist of a crocheted rectangle which is covered in buttons, beads, pom-poms, ribbon and trimmings, they are then sewn into a muff by making one seam! So let your creativity run wild and help a dementia patient in the process.

This pattern contains instructions for making the item with both DK and Chunky yarn. Size can also be adapted, instructions for which can be found in the pattern.

Materials needed other than yarn and hook: (optional but really make the twiddle muff fun!)
-Darning Needle
-Buttons
-Ribbon
-Pom-poms
-Beads

733767.name: Strawberry menstrual cup pouch
733767.gauge_description: 13 stitches and 15 rows = 2 inches in single crochet worked in round
733767.notes_html:
This menstrual cup pouch is uniquely life-like because of its lacy leafs.
It was designed to fit snugly around Mooncup A, however most cups have similar dimensions and it should fit any cup well. If your cup is unusually long or lacks a stem - it is easy to adapt and instructions are provided.

Construction:
It is crocheted at an amigurumi-style tight gauge, in spiral, with the height easily adaptable to your own cup. Next lacy leaves are crocheted, a tape is chained and finally seeds are embroidered. You only work one colour at a time.

Techniques:
The strawberry uses magic ring, single crochets, double crochets and increasing single crochets.
The leaves use Chainless Foundation style stitches (half-double to triple treble crochets), which are similar to Extended stitches, and regular half-double to triple treble stitches. Because this is an uncommon technique, the leaf construction and its stitches are explained in text, chart and the accompanying video. If you have ever worked any chainless foundation stitch, it will be very easy to follow.
The tape uses chains.

Materials and tools:
10 grams (0.35 oz) of red sport weight yarn (e.g. YarnArt Jeans 56)
5 grams (0.17 oz) of green sport weight yarn (e.g. YarnArt Jeans 52)
2 meters (2 yards) of black sport weight yarn (e.g. YarnArt Jeans 53)
One stitch marker
2,5mm crochet hook (or hook required to meet the gauge)
tapestry/yarn needle
733767.notes:
This menstrual cup pouch is uniquely life-like because of its lacy leafs.
It was designed to fit snugly around Mooncup A, however most cups have similar dimensions and it should fit any cup well. If your cup is unusually long or lacks a stem - it is easy to adapt and instructions are provided.

**Construction:** 
It is crocheted at an amigurumi-style tight gauge, in spiral, with the height easily adaptable to your own cup. Next lacy leaves are crocheted, a tape is chained and finally seeds are embroidered. You only work one colour at a time.

**Techniques:** 
The strawberry uses magic ring, single crochets, double crochets and increasing single crochets. 
The leaves use Chainless Foundation style stitches (half-double to triple treble crochets), which are similar to Extended stitches, and regular half-double to triple treble stitches. Because this is an uncommon technique, the leaf construction and its stitches are explained in text, chart and the accompanying video. If you have ever worked any chainless foundation stitch, it will be very easy to follow.
The tape uses chains.

**Materials and tools:** 
10 grams (0.35 oz) of red sport weight yarn (e.g. YarnArt Jeans 56)
5 grams (0.17 oz) of green sport weight yarn (e.g. YarnArt Jeans 52)
2 meters (2 yards) of black sport weight yarn (e.g. YarnArt Jeans 53)
One stitch marker
2,5mm crochet hook (or hook required to meet the gauge)
tapestry/yarn needle

pattern_author.name: Asia Kadłubowska
pattern_author.notes: Designing only when I have to

users.first_name: Joanna ('Asia' is my diminution of choice, where the 'si' pronounced close to japanese 'shi')
users.about_me:
Unplanned Cauliflower was too long, but that's what my name here is supposed to be.

Addicted to crochet since the day I first held a hook in my hand
I design when I absolutely need to

Polish, living in Germany

I want to be celebrated, but since almost nobody has ever done this, I don't know how. My nameday is May 12th and where I come from once you're adult, nameday is more of a thing than birthday
I organized a bbq party for my 30th birthday, it was great, there were lots of friends and their kids, the weather was wonderful... the next year I tried to do this again. The day before the party the first person called to cancel. One person didn't even bother telling me they're not coming. One person showed up. ONE. It was one of the worst days because I was still expected to appreciate my one guest. So I kind of gave up on the idea of celebrating me,  again. But the thing is, I want to be celebrated. I want kisses and cards for Mother's day. I want gifts and I want friends and hugs and nice food. I don't care much about 'holidays', but I care about people and it broke my heart when my son's 11th birthday happened during the pandemic and I couldn't give him a gift

I keep my wishlist and projects up to date, so those are a reliable source on what I might want/enjoy.
I love red. TPO loves bright pink. TYO loves yellow. DH is the only one liking warmer tones.
Maybe an Ann Budd ruler?
I am a process crocheter/knitter, so I am usually open to commissions and trading my FOs for new yarn, also note the projects labelled "trade"

No allergies, no pets, no smoking.

I dislike bananas. I can't understand how people deem licorice edible. My family, though, likes them fine.
Lurve chocolate
I don't drink coffee, I can't stand the taste. I drink lots of tea, usually loose leaf.

I'd love to try other yarn crafts, but suffer a lack of teachers - so lessons?
I have an amazon wishlist: https://www.amazon.de/hz/wishlist/ls/133SV2VNYMFJK?ref_=wl_share

More info to come when I think of it.

Note that I've moved in October 2018. Consider older addresses invalid

Raveler #6170627

packs.yarn_name: Hobby Lobby I Love This Cotton!

758641.name: Crocheted Knocker
758641.sizes_available: A, B, C, D, DD (yardage listed is for size A, larger sizes will require more)
758641.notes_html: This pattern is based on the original knitted knocker - crocheted version, however this one features a side opening, rather than a bottom opening and a slightly concave bottom. Fingering or sport weight 100% cotton is preferred, a cotton blend is acceptable if it is very soft. Remember, these are worn against very sensitive skin and as such no animal fibers should be used due to possible allergens.
758641.notes: This pattern is based on the original knitted knocker - crocheted version, however this one features a side opening, rather than a bottom opening and a slightly concave bottom. 758698.name: Gefilte Fish - Well Tempered Fish
758698.notes_html:
Here’s a toy, which is also home remedy, because it can be used as an hot-and-cold pack! It also works great as a stress ball or home decoration.

My samples are about 5x5x1 inches in worsted weight yarn. You can use thinner yarn double-threaded. But, please, make sure it’s microwaveable and washable, if you want to use it as home remedy.

I recommend to fill it with dry lentils, because are very pliable and soft, but dry corn or beans, or a mix of these will work as well. You may also use a gel pack.

The making of this toy requires knitting skills like knit and purl, increase and decrease. It is knit flat. You may crochet or whipstitch the seam.

Please check out my other well tempered patterns - proceeds are going towards yarn and other supplies, like beans for example. My charity knitting group makes toys and other hand-knit items, which are donated to various good causes. With the proceeds of only one of the patterns we can make about ten toys!

Many thanks to yarnbirdy for the original rainbow fish pattern, which I modified with her permission!

users.about_me:
Both my grandmothers taught me how to crochet and how to knit when I was just a little kid. They kindled my interest by showing me new patterns and challenging me to start new projects until I was completely and utterly hooked.

When I went to the US in 2012, I found myself in the lucky position to have the head space and time to learn again and follow my dreams, pursue my hobbies and indulge my passions - like knitting for example.

Now, I’m back in Germany. But knitting never stops.

773526.name: Heart Heating Pad / Comfort Pack
773526.notes_html:
This crochet comfort pack is designed off of a heart scheme. I have provided the scheme and the written instructions for the scheme. Make 2 hearts, use single stitch to join them together.

There is a little sewing needed for the inner fabric shell that holds the dry rice.

Microwave in 30 second intervals for no more then 2 minutes. Can be placed in the freezer to use as a cold pack.

Pattern Notes:

Make 2 for the front and back of pad
Pull the slip stitches tight to get the decrease
Row 2 is worked on both sides of the chain
Leave a long tail at the beginning of chain to sew up any holes
Leave a long tail when fastening off to sew up holes at the chain 3 places

I would love to see your versions. Thank you for your support.

pattern_author.name: All That Crochet
pattern_author.notes: All That Crochet brings you fashionable & functional hand made items for home, baby, women, men. I have been an avid crocheter for over 10 years. My philosophy behind my crochet projects is that they must be functional not just beautiful. I love to make usable items for every day use that adds a spark of beauty and uniqueness to your life. I enjoy creating items that make an ordinary task better with creative beauty.

791919.name: Amigurumi Uterus Rice Pack
791919.notes_html:
This listing is for the PATTERN ONLY! It includes instructions to make a fun, uterus shaped shell, that holds a rice heat/cold pack! The rice pack can be easily removed and used either hot or cold to provide comfort.

The uterus is crocheted in continuous rounds, using worsted weight yarn and a 4mm hook. The finished product is approximately 9-10 inches tall when finished.

807316.name: Amon ammeinnlegg
807316.notes_html:
Ordet Amon kjem frå egyptisk “den som er skjult” og var namnet på ein fruktbarheits-, storm-, og solgud. På eit tidspunkt var Amon hovudguden innan egyptisk mytologi og vart sett på som opphavsmannen og beskyttaren til verda. (Store norske leksikon, 2017, henta frå https://snl.no/Amon)

Alle mødre er opphav og beskyttarar akkurat som Amon. Eg ser på dei som heltar eller gudar. Eg ynskjer at denne oppskrifta på “det som er skjult” skal vere til desse desse gudane - mødre.

Ammeinnlegget kjem i tre ulike storleikar. Oppskrifta passar til alle garn, og er eit supert restegarnprosjekt. Dei kan lagast einsfarga eller som forklart med nippel. Eit par veg om lag 20 g.

Eg anbefalar å bruke eit reint ullgarn som ikkje er superwashbehandla. Dette vil varme godt sjølv om det blir vått av mjølk, og vil suge væska til seg. Tålar du ikkje ull så godt, bruk eit vanleg ammeinnlegg innanfor ullinnlegget. Ammeinnlegga bør strikkast på eit halvt pinnenummer mindre enn anbefalt på garnet for å få det tett nok.

Alle mødre er opphav og beskyttarar akkurat som Amon. Eg ser på dei som heltar eller gudar. Eg ynskjer at denne oppskrifta på "det som er skjult" skal vere til desse desse gudane - mødre. 

Ammeinnlegget kjem i tre ulike storleikar. Oppskrifta passar til alle garn, og er eit supert restegarnprosjekt. Dei kan lagast einsfarga eller som forklart med nippel. Eit par veg om lag 20 g. 

Eg anbefalar å bruke eit reint ullgarn som ikkje er superwashbehandla. Dette vil varme godt sjølv om det blir vått av mjølk, og vil suge væska til seg. Tålar du ikkje ull så godt, bruk eit vanleg ammeinnlegg innanfor ullinnlegget. Ammeinnlegga bør strikkast på eit halvt pinnenummer mindre enn anbefalt på garnet for å få det tett nok.

1047164.name: Textured Sensory blanket
1047164.notes_html:
When someone you love has Alzheimer’s it is sometimes difficult to know what to gift them on their birthday. We had learned through our experience with Alzheimer’s that sensory played a part in brain stimulation. We thought we could bring together sensory stimulation and the warmth and coziness of a jumper together, the idea for the textured sensory blanket was born.
The idea behind this blanket is that loved ones will be able to make a gift that will be both practical and personal. This pattern provides ways to personalise the blanket from the choice of the yarn to the additional attachments on certain squares.
There are two mesh squares where ribbons, yarn or even fabric from an old shirt could be weaved in and out to provide extra texture and personalisation. One attachment square where you can add bells, pompoms, cotton wheels, badges, or anything that can be sewn on. This is a great square to make the blanket really personal by adding things that mean something or represent something about the person.
Made up of squares using different stitch patterns to provide texture, along with different types of yarn this blanket is a beautiful gift for your loved one.

By buying this pattern you have contributed to helping find an end to Alzheimer’s. All profits of the sale of this pattern will go to Alzheimer’s research.

This crochet pattern is written using UK crochet terms.

All the of yarn in this pattern is DK, 100g of each colour and 150g of natural or white.

Light Green Teal
Yellow Red/brown
Aqua Dark blue
Light blue Grey/white
Dark green Dark green (felted)
Natural undyed

7303390.name: Crochet Fidget Toys
7303390.notes_html:
This ebook provides three patterns to create crochet fidget toys including
Fidget Worry Worm
Fidget Octopus
Fidget Bumpy Ball

Crochet fidget toys can be incredibly beneficial in various ways. These tactile creations serve as practical tools to channel excess energy, improve focus, and reduce stress or anxiety levels.

Some ways Crochet Fidget Toys can help:

  1. Tactile Stimulation: Engages senses, providing a calming effect.
  2. Improved Focus: Channels excess energy for better concentration.
  3. Stress Relief: Offers a soothing activity, reducing anxiety levels.
  4. Fine Motor Skills: Enhances hand dexterity through manipulation.
  5. Sensory Outlet: Meets sensory needs discreetly and acceptably.

7409517.gauge_pattern: Gauge not important for this pattern
7409517.name: Two-Tone Fidget Square
7409517.gauge_description: Gauge not important for this pattern
7409517.notes_html:
Free version of this pattern is available on our website.

Is this Two-Tone Fidget Square giving anyone else 90’s vibes? Crocheted bead fidgets are popular with adults and kids, and this one is super easy. All you need is some scrap yarn and beads big enough to fit over a crochet hook! This pattern can be easily customised to make fidgets as big or small as you like. Using a 3.5mm hook and Aran weight yarn, our Two-Tone Fidget Square is approx. 7cm x 7cm.

This crochet pattern is written for beginners and neurodiverse crafters. The abbreviated instructions are followed by a breakdown in italics making it easier to understand what you need to do in each row. If you’ve had trouble reading patterns in the past, we hope that you’ll give our patterns a try!

Materials
Aran weight yarn in two colours (Spot Saver USA)
Pink (Main Colour)
White (Contrasting Colour)
3.5mm crochet hook
Pony Beads – 9mm (20 beads)
Scissors
Tapestry needle
7409517.notes:
**Free version of this pattern is available on our website.**

Using a 3.5mm hook and Aran weight yarn, our Two-Tone Fidget Square is approx. 7cm x 7cm.

This crochet pattern is written for beginners and neurodiverse crafters. The abbreviated instructions are followed by a breakdown in italics making it easier to understand what you need to do in each row. If you’ve had trouble reading patterns in the past, we hope that you’ll give our patterns a try!

**Materials**
Aran weight yarn in two colours (Spot Saver USA)
Pink (Main Colour)
White (Contrasting Colour) 
3.5mm crochet hook
Pony Beads – 9mm (20 beads) 
Scissors
Tapestry needle

users.about_me:
**Fox Creations** is a family-run crafty business based in Adelaide, South Australia. We love crafting and just about anything to do with yarn. Our mission is to help as many people as possible to access and enjoy the world of amigurumi and crochet. We’re committed to creating beginner-friendly patterns which have been developed in conjunction with neurodiverse crafters.

We are LGBTQIA+ friendly and believe in inclusivity and diversity within our community.

7414925.name: Crochet Bird Fidget
7414925.notes_html:
This listing is for a PDF PATTERN ONLY.
It is not for a physical item.

Included in the digital download is the crochet pattern for the Beaded Fidget Baby Blue Bird. This baby bird works up super-fast and is perfect for markets. It took me about 30 minutes to whip it up! This allows for great margins for markets.

Fidget toys are popular with children and adults and are helpful tools for people with ADHD and autism.

This pattern is suitable for beginner crocheters. I have included pictures throughout to help you through the project. The pattern is written in US terms.

Recommended Materials:
Acrylic yarn (Weight 4)
Pony Beads (9mm)
3.5mm hook (small enough to fit through bead hole)

Don’t forget to tag TheKnottedDinosaur with your finished photos!
7414925.notes:
This listing is for a PDF PATTERN ONLY.
It is not for a physical item.

Included in the digital download is the crochet pattern for the Beaded Fidget Baby Blue Bird. This baby bird works up super-fast and is perfect for markets. It took me about 30 minutes to whip it up! This allows for great margins for markets. 

Fidget toys are popular with children and adults and are helpful tools for people with ADHD and autism.

This pattern is suitable for beginner crocheters. I have included pictures throughout to help you through the project. The pattern is written in US terms.

Recommended Materials:
Acrylic yarn (Weight 4)
Pony Beads (9mm)
3.5mm hook (small enough to fit through bead hole)
 
Don't forget to tag TheKnottedDinosaur with your finished photos!

7416656.name: Fidget Bracelets
7416656.yarn_weight_description: Any gauge - designed for any gauge

users.about_me: As a stay at home mum, I taught myself crochet as a way to unwind and create beautiful things for my family and friends.  Little did I know, my passion for crochet would turn into a full-fledged business. Before discovering my love for crochet, I earned a degree in graphic design. Combining my creative skills and passion for yarn, I founded Hanny Handmade, where I create unique and personalized pieces.
users.about_me_html: As a stay at home mum, I taught myself crochet as a way to unwind and create beautiful things for my family and friends. Little did I know, my passion for crochet would turn into a full-fledged business. Before discovering my love for crochet, I earned a degree in graphic design. Combining my creative skills and passion for yarn, I founded Hanny Handmade, where I create unique and personalized pieces.

7416950.name: Sistema Reprodutor Feminino
7416950.notes_html:
Padrão em Português do Sistema Reprodutor Feminino – Amigurumi

Aprenda a criar um modelo anatômico detalhado com este padrão exclusivo! Ideal para professores, profissionais de saúde e entusiastas do crochet.

O que inclui:
✔ Partes do sistema reprodutor feminino: Vagina, útero, canal vaginal, bexiga e clitóris
✔ Tutoriais explicativos passo a passo
✔ Pontos utilizados: Ponto baixo, ponto baixíssimo, ponto alto e correntes
✔ Material recomendado: Linhas 100% algodão para um acabamento perfeito

Disponível também em Inglês e Espanhol!

users.about_me:
Hi my name is Telma, I work for a telecommunications company.
Since I was a little girl, I always liked art and crafts. For the past two years I have been devoting more time to my hobby and what I really enjoy doing. The fact that we are confined, I think has given us all another perspective on life. I have a cat named Tito and a dog named Lola and they are my loves. Welcome to my little space here at Ravelry.
I hope you have fun with my work. Little kisses.

7416990.name: Colors and Shapes Play Mat
7416990.notes_html: This is a pattern for a color and shape identifying game to play with toddlers! The mat is made in two panels and stitched together, and the shapes are all individual pieces. Gauge is unimportant for this toy. I used a conglomerate of brands for my pattern example (Big Twist, RHSS, and an unknown stash skein), so please feel free to use whatever is in your stash!

7419970.name: Emotional support Pickle
7419970.notes_html:
*** Beginner to intermediate level ***

You will need to know the following stitches:

Ch : Chain
Sc : Single crochet
Inc : Increase
InvDec : Invisible decrease
MR : Magic ring

Puff stitches are also in this pattern, but a description to make them is described.

You will need
3.5 mm crochet hook
Loops & Threads medium (4) yarn – Green color
Loops & Treads medium (4) yarn – Black color
Loops & Treads medium (4) yarn – Pink color
1 pair of 8 mm safety eyes
Tapestry needle
Scissors
Stitch marker
Polyester fiber fill
Regular needle
Emotional support card (text of your choice)
Black or dark green sewing thread
Felting needle (recommended)
Laminator (optional)

7420020.name: Pelota sensorial
7420020.yarn_weight_description: Any gauge - designed for any gauge
7420020.notes_html:
Hi! We are Kawaka Crochet.

We give you our twenty-six pattern in Ravelry. This is a written pattern of an Ebook Sensory ball. You can download the PDF with the detailed instructions to knit your own Sensory ball. It is very simple and quick to do.

This pattern is only in Spanish. So if you are a Spanish user, you can make your creation following this pattern without any problem!

It is not allowed to sell the results you get with our patterns or disseminate partially or totally its content through any channel without the consent of Kawaka Crochet. Also, it is not allowed to share, sell, modify, translate to another language, distribute or publish partially or totally any of its content without express written consent from Kawaka Crochet.

Ah! One more thing. If you share your Kawaka Crochet creations on your social networks, we greatly appreciate that you mention us as @kawakacrochet. Thank you very much and we hope you like our pattern! Enjoy!

7422339.name: Bartleby Bunny Sensory Snuggler
7422339.notes_html:
Meet Bartleby Bunny! Bartleby is a ‘Sensory Snuggler,’ a fun combo of huggable plushie/stuffie and blanket, with the addition of sensory elements.

Bartleby has sensory elements to help entertain little ones! See below for suggested items (please note I do make a small commission on items purchased from these links as an Amazon Associate):

  1. Crinkly Paper/Phonic Filler - https://amzn.to/4gYGHCg
  2. Circular Rattles - https://amzn.to/3PlrAXu
  3. Circular Teethers - https://amzn.to/40elcrk
  4. Baby Chain Links - needed to attach toys to the body - https://amzn.to/4fBVCk
  5. Rattles and/or Squeakers - https://amzn.to/4l7NH2j

He also has a loop at the head to attach to a stroller/car seat, etc. He clocks in at roughly 10-11 inches tall using suggested yarn.

Supplies Needed:
Yarn:
Size 6 Super Bulky such as Bernat Baby Blanket or similar (Premier Basix Chenille, etc.) in 2-4 colors.

  1. Main Color
  2. Body Contrast Color
  3. Limb Color
  4. A very small amount for embroidered eyes (Blanket in ‘Coal’) - Approx 1 yd
  5. A very small amount for embroidered eyes (Baby Blanket in ‘Vanilla’ - Approx 1 yd

Hook:
6.5mm and 7mm hooks

Stitch Markers
Scissors
Polyfil Stuffing
Needle for sewing in ends and face details
